intro: Berberis andrieuxii, commonly known as the Andrieux barberry, is a deciduous shrub native to the mountainous regions of China. It features thorny stems and lance-shaped leaves that turn yellow in the fall. The plant produces small, orange-red berries that are edible but often used more for ornamental purposes. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or as a hedge. Its hardy nature and attractive foliage make it a popular plant in horticulture.
